meanings.definition: The state or quality of being unworthy.
meanings.sent1: Her constant self-doubt reflected her deep unworthinesses.
meanings.sent2: The judge's decision to disqualify the contestant was based on her unworthinesses.
meanings.sent3: Despite his unworthinesses, he still tried his best to help others.
meanings.sent4: The unworthinesses of the old building were evident in its crumbling walls.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of unworthinesses weighed heavily on her heart.

meanings.sent1: The cheap knockoff had many unworthinesses compared to the original product.
meanings.sent2: The charity refused the donation due to its unworthinesses.
meanings.sent3: The unworthinesses of the old toy became apparent when it broke after one use.
meanings.sent4: His unworthinesses in the eyes of his peers made him feel isolated.
meanings.sent5: The unworthinesses of the fake painting were exposed by the art expert.

meanings.sent1: The unworthinesses of the old car were evident in its constant breakdowns.
meanings.sent2: The job applicant's unworthinesses became apparent during the interview.
meanings.sent3: Despite its unworthinesses, the old couch held sentimental value for the family.
meanings.sent4: The unworthinesses of the outdated software led to its replacement.
meanings.sent5: The unworthinesses of the broken umbrella were revealed during the storm.
